2.text: “Listen carefully to my words; let this be your consolation to me.

3.text: Bear with me while I speak; then, after I have spoken, you may go on mocking.

4.text: Is my complaint against a man? Then why should I not be impatient?

5.text: Look at me and be appalled; put your hand over your mouth.

6.text: When I remember, terror takes hold, and my body trembles in horror.

7.text: Why do the wicked live on, growing old and increasing in power?

8.text: Their descendants are established around them, and their offspring before their eyes.

9.text: Their homes are safe from fear; no rod of punishment from God is upon them.

10.text: Their bulls breed without fail; their cows bear calves and do not miscarry.

11.text: They send forth their little ones like a flock; their children skip about,

12.text: singing to the tambourine and lyre and making merry at the sound of the flute.

13.text: They spend their days in prosperity and go down to Sheol in peace.

14.text: Yet they say to God: ‘Leave us alone! For we have no desire to know Your ways.

15.text: Who is the Almighty, that we should serve Him, and what would we gain if we pray to Him?’

16.text: Still, their prosperity is not in their own hands, so I stay far from the counsel of the wicked.

17.text: How often is the lamp of the wicked put out? Does disaster come upon them? Does God, in His anger, apportion destruction?

18.text: Are they like straw before the wind, like chaff swept away by a storm?

19.text: It is said that God lays up one’s punishment for his children. Let God repay the man himself, so he will know it.

20.text: Let his eyes see his own destruction; let him drink for himself the wrath of the Almighty.

21.text: For what does he care about his household after him, when the number of his months has run out?

22.text: Can anyone teach knowledge to God, since He judges those on high?

23.text: One man dies full of vigor, completely secure and at ease.

24.text: His body is well nourished, and his bones are rich with marrow.

25.text: Yet another man dies in the bitterness of his soul, having never tasted prosperity.

26.text: But together they lie down in the dust, and worms cover them both.

27.text: Behold, I know your thoughts full well, the schemes by which you would wrong me.

28.text: For you say, ‘Where now is the nobleman’s house, and where are the tents in which the wicked dwell?’

29.text: Have you never asked those who travel the roads? Do you not accept their reports?

30.text: Indeed, the evil man is spared from the day of calamity, delivered from the day of wrath.

31.text: Who denounces his behavior to his face? Who repays him for what he has done?

32.text: He is carried to the grave, and watch is kept over his tomb.

33.text: The clods of the valley are sweet to him; everyone follows behind him, and those before him are without number.

34.text: So how can you comfort me with empty words? For your answers remain full of falsehood.”
